name: Frost Dragon
location: Dragon lairs, word walls, random encounters

aspects.high_concept: Ancient Dov of Ice and Sky

stunts: Frost Breath (Thu'um): Use Lore to attack all targets in zone. On hit, creates 'Frozen' aspect (difficulty +2 to physical actions)
Aerial Superiority: +2 to all actions while airborne against ground-based targets
Tail Sweep: Attack all adjacent targets at -1
Dragon Fear: Use Provoke to create 'Terrified' aspect on all nearby enemies (opposed by Will)
Impenetrable Scales: Armor: 3 against physical attacks
Powerful Wings: Can create 'Knocked Prone' aspect with athletics, affecting entire zone
notes: Frost dragons are ancient, intelligent beings. While Alduin has been defeated, scattered dragons still exist in Skyrim. They are proud, arrogant, and utterly convinced of their superiority. They view mortals as food or playthings. A dragon encounter is still an epic and dangerous event, representing remaining threats from the dragon crisis.

special_mechanics.flight: Can switch between airborne and grounded states as a free action
special_mechanics.shout_cooldown: After using breath weapon, cannot use again for 2 exchanges
special_mechanics.dragon_soul: When killed by those with dragon blood, the soul may be absorbed (optional mechanic)
special_mechanics.word_wall: Often guards or is near a word wall

phases.name: Aerial Phase
phases.description: Dragon strafes with breath attacks and stays airborne
phases.tactics: Use Frost Breath and Aerial Superiority, avoid melee
phases.transition: After taking moderate consequence or when physical stress half-filled

phases.name: Ground Phase
phases.description: Dragon lands and engages in melee
phases.tactics: Use Fight, Tail Sweep, and Wing attacks. Use Frost Breath when recharged
phases.transition: Fights to the death on ground

combat_tactics: Dragons begin combat airborne, using Frost Breath to weaken and scatter enemies. They'll use Dragon Fear to break morale. Once significantly wounded, they land and fight with physical attacks, using their superior strength and armor. Dragons are intelligent and will taunt enemies, boast of their power, and mock 'joor' (mortals).
scene_triggers: Rare world encounters with remaining dragons

dialogue.on_encounter: Zu'u unslaad! Zu'u nis oblaan! (I am eternal! I cannot die!)
during_combat: You are no match for a Dov!
Your bones will feed my hunger!
dialogue.when_wounded: Impossible! How do you harm a god?!
dialogue.on_death: Dovahkiin... No... (or generic dragon death roar)

location_specific: Word of Power (if near word wall)

variants.name: Elder Dragon
variants.changes: Increase all skills by +1, add 2 more stress boxes, Armor: 4

variants.name: Ancient Dragon
variants.changes: Increase all skills by +2, add 4 more stress boxes, Armor: 4, additional shout ability

variants.name: Blood Dragon
variants.changes: Replace Frost Breath with Fire Breath (creates 'Burning' aspect)
